text: Optimizing tail calls If we have a call x= CALL f(a1,...,an); RETURN z in the body of a function g, we can generate code that allows us to re-use the stack frame that the call of g used. Ø Transfer the parameters from aj, ..., a, to the registers or stack locations used to pass parameters. Ø Restore the callee-saves registers that were used in the body of g. This can include the return address register. Ø Free the space used for storing variables and other entities. This can include the space used to store the return address. Ø Store the old return address of g, and jump to the function label f
